needle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a small thin piece of steel, with a point at one end and a hole in the other, used for sewing
needle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a very thin, pointed steel tube at the end of a syringe, which is pushed into your skin to put a drug or medicine into your body or to take out blood
needle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: She carried hypodermic needles and syringes in her bag.
Drug users are at risk when they share needles.
needle.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a long thin piece of metal on a scientific instrument that moves backwards and forwards and points to numbers or directions
needle.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a long, very thin piece of metal used in acupuncture (=a kind of medical treatment originally used in China)
needle.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a small needle-shaped leaf, especially from a pine tree
needle.translation[0].definitions[6].def: the very small, pointed part in a record player that touches the record in order to play it
needle.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: I don't think he even knows how to use a needle!
I got a needle and thread and sewed the button back on.
This gadget helps you put the thread through the eye of the needle.
needle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to deliberately annoy someone by making unkind remarks or jokes about them
needle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: I just said that to Charlie to needle him.
